Name: Redgate - Create Database Release (Worker Friendly)
Description:
Creates the resources (including the SQL update script) to deploy database changes using Redgate's [SQL Change Automation](https://www.red-gate.com/products/sql-development/sql-change-automation/), and exports them as Octopus artifacts so you can review the changes before deploying.

Requires SQL Change Automation version 3.0.2 or later.

*Version date: 2019-07-26*

This step template is worker friendly, you can pass in a package reference rather than having to reference a previous step which downloaded the package. This step requires Octopus Deploy **2019.10.0** or higher.
Author: octobob

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDeploymentResourcesPath
Parameters.Label: Export path
Parameters.HelpText:
The path that the database deployment resources will be exported to.

This path is used in the "Redgate - Deploy from Database Release" step, and must be accessible to all tentacles used in database deployment steps.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationPackageName
Parameters.Label: Package
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the package to extract

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDeleteExistingFiles
Parameters.Label: Delete files in export folder
Parameters.HelpText: If the folder that the deployment resources are exported to isn't empty, this step will fail. Select this option to delete any files in the folder.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseServer
Parameters.Label: Target SQL Server instance
Parameters.HelpText: The fully qualified SQL Server instance name for the target database.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseName
Parameters.Label: Target database name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the database that the source schema (the database package) will be compared with to generate the deployment resources. This must be an existing database.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabaseUsername
Parameters.Label: Username (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: The SQL Server username used to connect to the database. If you leave this field and 'Password' blank, Windows authentication will be used to connect instead, using the account that runs the Tentacle service.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDatabasePassword
Parameters.Label: Password (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: You must enter a password if you entered a username.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationFilterPath
Parameters.Label: Filter path (optional)
Parameters.HelpText:
Specify the location of a SQL Compare filter file (.scpf), which defines objects to include/exclude in the schema comparison. Filter files are generated by SQL Source Control.

For more help see [Using SQL Compare filters in SQL Change Automation](http://www.red-gate.com/sca/ps/help/filters).

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationCompareOptions
Parameters.Label: SQL Compare options (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: Enter SQL Compare options to apply when generating the update script. Use a comma-separated list to enter multiple values. For more help see [Using SQL Compare options in SQL Change Automation](http://www.red-gate.com/sca/add-ons/compare-options).

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationDataCompareOptions
Parameters.Label: SQL Data Compare options (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: Enter SQL Data Compare options to apply when generating the update script. Use a comma-separated list to enter multiple values. For more help see [Using SQL Data Compare options in SQL Change Automation](https://documentation.red-gate.com/sca4/deploying-database-changes/automated-deployment-with-sql-source-control-projects/using-comparison-options-with-sql-change-automation-powershell-module-for-sql-source-control-projects).

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationTransactionIsolationLevel
Parameters.Label: Transaction isolation level (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: Select the transaction isolation level to be used in deployment scripts.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationIgnoreStaticData
Parameters.Label: Ignore static data
Parameters.HelpText: Exclude changes to static data when generating the deployment resources.

Parameters.Name: DLMAutomationIncludeIdenticalsInReport
Parameters.Label: Include identical objects in the change report
Parameters.HelpText: By default, the change report only includes added, modified and removed objects. Choose this option to also include identical objects.

Parameters.Name: SpecificModuleVersion
Parameters.Label: SQL Change Automation version (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: If you wish to use a specific version of SQL Change Automation rather than the latest, enter the version number here.

Parameters.Name: DLMModuleInstallLocation
Parameters.Label: SQL Change Automation Install Location (optional)
Parameters.HelpText:
The SQL Change Automation cmdlets will be downloaded from the [PowerShell gallery](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/SqlChangeAutomation).  Please specify the folder folder where those packages will be saved to.  It can be relative or absolute.


If this is empty it will default `$Home\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules` which is the [recommended location](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/developer/module/installing-a-powershell-module?view=powershell-7#where-to-install-modules) from Microsoft.
